title: Ticket #6376: Dedicated Scheduler not releasing claims in some cases
description: If the dedicated scheduler claims a startd, but the job is removed before it is started, the claim is never released, even after UNUSED_CLAIM_TIMEOUT seconds.
remarks:
2017-Sep-07 14:56:31 by jpatton:
CODE REVIEW Looks good.

Some additional context (please correct if wrong): Prior to fix, after a condor_rm of a PU job, resources could still end up claimed (and "scheduled") by the DS if multiple negotiation cycles happened during the scheduling. This fix removes the protection of such resources in such state.
